original: ARTICLE 1 LICENSE GRANT 1.1. License . Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, the Licensor hereby grants to the Licensee, and the Licensee hereby accepts from the Licensor, a personal, non-exclusive, royalty-free right and license to use the Licensed Mark in the Territory solely and exclusively as a component of the Licensee’s own company name and in connection with the Licensed Services and any business provided in conjunction therewith by such Licensee. During the term of this Agreement, the Licensee shall use the Licensed Mark only to the extent permitted under this Agreement, and except as provided above, neither the Licensee nor any of its affiliates, owners, directors, officers, employees or agents shall otherwise use the Licensed Mark or any derivatives without the prior express written consent of the Licensor in its sole and absolute discretion. All rights not expressly granted to the Licensee hereunder shall remain the exclusive property of the Licensor. Upon written notification by the Licensor Source: NMF SLF I, INC., 10-12G/A, 1/15/2020 to the Licensee of noncompliance with the Licensor’s quality standards in any material respect, such Licensee shall take appropriate steps, in a commercially reasonable time frame, not to exceed sixty (60) days, to cure such noncompliance.

ARTICLE 1 LICENSE GRANT

1.1. Permission Granted. Under the provisions of this Agreement, the Licensor grants a non-exclusive, personal, and royalty-free permission to the Licensee for the use of the Licensed Mark within the Territory. The Licensee is allowed to incorporate the Licensed Mark as part of its own brand identity, solely in relation to the Licensed Services and any related business activities. However, the Licensee's usage of the Licensed Mark shall adhere strictly to this Agreement, and without the Licensor's prior written consent, neither the Licensee nor any of its affiliates, shareholders, executives, employees, or agents may utilize the Licensed Mark or derivatives in any other capacity. All rights not explicitly granted to the Licensee under this contract shall remain the exclusive domain of the Licensor.

1.2. Remedy for Quality Issues. In the event that the Licensor identifies any significant deviations from its quality standards in the Licensee's work, the Licensee will have a reasonable period of time, not to exceed sixty (60) days, to rectify the issue. The timeline for rectification may be extended at the sole discretion of the Licensor, should additional time be necessary for the Licensee to comply with the quality standards. Failure to meet these requirements may result in the termination of this Agreement by the Licensor.

original: 1.4. Goodwill . All goodwill and reputation generated by the Licensee’s use of the Licensed Mark shall inure to the benefit of Licensor. The Licensee shall not by any act or omission use the Licensed Mark in any manner that disparages or reflects adversely on Licensor or its business or reputation.
ollama_generated:
1.4. Goodwill and Reputation Transferal. All goodwill and reputation derived from the Licensor's association with the Licensee's use of the Licensed Mark shall be deemed to accrue to the benefit of the Licensee. The Licensor shall not, by any action or inaction, utilize the Licensed Mark in a manner that enhances or reflects positively upon the Licensee or its business or reputation, without prior written consent.

Explanation: The original clause protects the licensor's goodwill and reputation from harm caused by the licensee's use of the licensed mark. This revised clause shifts this protection to the licensee, implying that any positive impact on Licensor's reputation or business will now benefit the Licensee, subject to Licensor's prior written consent for any positive association.

original: 2.3. Notification of Infringement . Each party shall immediately notify the other party and provide to the other party all relevant background facts upon becoming aware of (a) any registrations of, or applications for registration of, marks in the Territory that do or may conflict with the Licensor’s rights in the Licensed Mark or the rights granted to the Licensee under this Agreement, (b) any infringements or misuses of the Licensed Mark in the Territory by any third party (“ Third Party Infringement ”) or (c) any claim that Licensee’s use of the Licensed Mark infringes the intellectual property rights of any third party in the Territory (“ Third Party Claim ”). The Licensor shall have the exclusive right, but not the obligation, to prosecute, defend and/or settle in its sole discretion, all actions, proceedings and claims involving any Third Party Infringement or Third Party Claim, and to take any other action that it deems necessary or proper for the protection and preservation of its rights in the Licensed Mark. The Licensee shall cooperate with the Licensor in the prosecution, defense or settlement of such actions, proceedings or claims.

2.3. Notification of Potential Conflicts and Claims Regarding Licensed Mark: Each party shall promptly inform the other party about any circumstances that may suggest a potential conflict with the Licensor's rights in the Licensed Mark or the rights granted to the Licensee under this Agreement. This includes, but is not limited to, (a) discoveries of existing registrations or applications for registration of marks in the Territory which might overlap with the Licensor's rights, (b) suspected infringements or misuses of the Licensed Mark by any third party ("Potential Third-Party Infringement"), and (c) any allegation that the Licensee's use of the Licensed Mark could violate a third party's intellectual property rights within the Territory ("Third-Party Allegation").

While the Licensor retains the exclusive right to act upon such matters, it is under no obligation to do so. The Licensor shall have the discretion to initiate, manage, and settle, at its own judgment, all legal actions, proceedings, and claims related to Potential Third-Party Infringement or Third-Party Allegations. The Licensee is expected to assist the Licensor in these endeavors as needed.

modified: 5.2. Transfer of Rights and Obligations: The Licensor grants the Licensee the right, at its own discretion, to assign, sublicense, pledge, grant as security, or otherwise transfer all or any part of its rights or duties under this Agreement, in whole or in part, to a third party. No such transfer shall require the Licensor's prior written consent, and any attempt by the Licensee to secure such consent shall be deemed unnecessary. Any purported transfer effected without this discretionary right shall not affect the validity of this Agreement but shall become binding upon acceptance by the third party with the consent of the Licensor, which consent may be granted or withheld in the Licensor's sole and absolute discretion. Any such transfer prior to acceptance by the third party with the Licensor's consent shall be void ab initio.

original: 5.7. No Waiver . The failure of any party to enforce at any time for any period the provisions of or any rights deriving from this Agreement shall not be construed to be a waiver of such provisions or rights or the right of such party thereafter to enforce such provisions, and no waiver shall be binding unless executed in writing by all parties hereto.
ollama_generated:
5.7. Non-Enforcement Clause. The decision of any party not to enforce at any given moment for a certain duration the terms or rights conferred by this Agreement will not be interpreted as a relinquishment of such terms or rights, nor a future foregone opportunity for that party to enforce these provisions. Any waiver must be in written form and signed by all parties involved in this agreement.

In essence, the intention behind this revised clause is to convey that the lack of enforcement of the Agreement's provisions or rights does not imply a permanent forfeiture of such rights or the ability to enforce them at a later stage. Additionally, it emphasizes the necessity of a written and signed document to make any waiver binding on all parties.

original: Source: NMF SLF I, INC., 10-12G/A, 1/15/2020 5.10. Counterparts . This Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts, each of which when executed shall be deemed to be an original instrument and all of which taken together shall constitute one and the same agreement.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Revised: NMF SLF I, INC., 10-12G/A, 1/15/2020 5.10. Multiple Executions . This Agreement may be signed separately by the parties involved, with each separate signature constituting a valid and binding portion of the agreement. However, for the Agreement to be considered fully executed, all counterparts must be collected and combined. In the event that not all counterparts can be located or obtained, this Agreement shall remain binding and enforceable only upon the portions executed by the parties who were able to produce their signed counterparts.

LICENSEE UNDERSTANDS AND AGREES AS FOLLOWS:

In the event of any dispute arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, Licensee shall make reasonable efforts to resolve such disputes amicably with LICENSOR. However, if no resolution is reached within a period of sixty (60) days after the commencement of such discussions, either party may invoke arbitration proceedings under applicable laws and regulations.

In contrast, original clause imposed an obligation on Licensee to initiate discussion for dispute resolution within 60 days and threatened potential termination if no agreement was reached within that timeframe. The revised clause shifts the responsibility of invoking arbitration proceedings to either party, and allows for a longer duration (beyond 60 days) for discussions before resorting to arbitration.

Title: Altered Obligation Regarding Data Security Measures

Original Clause: The Client shall maintain appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect the Confidential Information from unauthorized access, use, disclosure, modification, or destruction.

Altered Clause: The Service Provider shall implement reasonable technical and organizational measures to safeguard the Confidential Information from unauthorized access, use, disclosure, modification, or destruction, although the Client acknowledges that no system is impenetrable.

Explanation: In this revised clause, I've shifted some of the responsibility for data security measures to the Service Provider while maintaining a reasonable standard (reasonable technical and organizational measures). Additionally, I added a disclaimer that no system can be entirely secure (although no system is impenetrable), which helps the Service Provider avoid liability if a breach occurs.
